con:soapui-project.name: C-Loginbuddy-Flows
con:soapui-project.con:description: These tests verify different flows with public and configdential clients. Always against the test server (FAKE)

con:settings.con:setting: <xml-fragment xmlns:con="http://eviware.com/soapui/config"> <con:entry key="Print Report Statistics" value="false"/> <con:entry key="Report Format(s)" value=""/> <con:entry key="Host:Port" value=""/> <con:entry key="Save After" value="false"/> <con:entry key="Add Settings" value="false"/> <con:entry key="WSS Password Type" value=""/> <con:entry key="TestSuite" value="<all>"/> <con:entry key="Endpoint" value=""/> <con:entry key="System Properties" value=""/> <con:entry key="Report to Generate" value=""/> <con:entry key="Password" value=""/> <con:entry key="LoadTest" value="<all>"/> <con:entry key="Open Report" value="false"/> <con:entry key="Global Properties" value=""/> <con:entry key="Project Properties" value=""/> <con:entry key="ThreadCount" value=""/> <con:entry key="Project Password" value=""/> <con:entry key="TestCase" value="<all>"/> <con:entry key="Username" value=""/> <con:entry key="user-settings.xml Password" value=""/> <con:entry key="TestRunner Path" value="/Applications/SoapUI-5.4.0.app/Contents/Resources/app/bin"/> <con:entry key="Environment" value="Default"/> <con:entry key="Limit" value=""/> <con:entry key="Root Folder" value=""/> <con:entry key="Domain" value=""/> <con:entry key="Tool Args" value=""/> <con:entry key="Save Project" value="false"/> </xml-fragment>

con:config.name: client-loginbuddy-requestProviderList
con:config.con:description: Client calls lbginbuddy to retrieve list of providers. This checks for the existence of the 'fake' provider for testing purposes.

con:testStep.name: loginbuddy-getDetails
con:testStep.con:description: Extract the 'state' parameter and get the 'action' which is the next location

con:testStep.name: loginbuddy-nextLocation
con:testStep.con:description: Setting a variable to be used later as URL path

con:config.name: loginbuddy-selectFakeProvider
con:config.con:description: Choosing the provider. Expects a redirect to the login page of the selected provider. Checks for required parameters

con:testStep.name: loginbuddy-setProviderEndpoint
con:testStep.con:description: Set the endpoint for the next test step

con:config.name: loginbuddy-provider-callFakeProvider
con:config.con:description: Calls the providers authorization endpoint and receives a login page

con:config.name: provider-provideEmailAddress
con:config.con:description: Inserting the users email address to be send to the login-endpoint of the provider

con:config.name: provider-providePassword
con:config.con:description: Inserting the users password to be send to the authenticate-endpoint of the provider

con:config.name: provider-grantAccess
con:config.con:description: Providing the users grant to be send to the consent-endpoint of the provider

con:testStep.name: loginbuddy-extractLocation
con:testStep.con:description: Extract the state

con:config.name: loginbuddy-exchangeCodeForToken
con:config.con:description: Forward the 'state' and 'code' to loginbuddy. Loginbuddy then calls the providers token-endpoint. It then issues its own 'code'

con:testStep.name: soapui-extractLocation
con:testStep.con:description: Extract the state

con:config.name: soapui-exchangeCodeForUserDetails
con:config.con:description: The client uses its 'code' to retrieve the user details

con:config.name: soapui-codeNotTwice
con:config.con:description: Verify that the 'code' can only be used once (here: success case)

con:config.name: discovery
con:config.con:description: Get the openid configuration, extract userinfo and jwks

con:config.name: userinfo via loginbuddy
con:config.con:description: Verify that the 'code' can only be used once (here: success case)

con:config.name: userinfo via loginbuddy (AuthHeader)
con:config.con:description: Verify that the 'code' can only be used once (here: success case)

con:settings.con:setting: <xml-fragment xmlns:con="http://eviware.com/soapui/config"> <con:entry key="Authorization" value="Bearer ${#accessToken}"/> <con:entry key="header1" value="value01"/> <con:entry key="header1" value="value02"/> </xml-fragment>

con:config.name: grant_type refresh_token
con:config.con:description: The client uses its 'code' to retrieve the user details

con:config.name: grant_type refresh_token - invalid client_id
con:config.con:description: The client uses its 'code' to retrieve the user details

con:config.name: grant_type refresh_token - missing token
con:config.con:description: The client uses its 'code' to retrieve the user details

con:configuration.content: either an invalid or missing refresh_token parameter
